body_html:
I got the same problem when I set the epsilon value less than 1e-5 on Ubuntu 16.04+CUDA 8.0.61+cuDNN 5.1.10. I used tensorflow 1.3.0 installed from source also.

According to the error, I read the cuDNN library user guide, and find the description about epsilon (in Section 4.95. cudnnBatchNormalizationForwardInference):

Input. Epsilon value used in the batch normalization formula. Minimum
allowed value is CUDNN_BN_MIN_EPSILON defined in cudnn.h.

So I check my cudnn.h, there is one line defined:

#define CUDNN_BN_MIN_EPSILON 1e-5 // Minimum epsilon allowed to be used in the Batch Normalization formula

I think that is why the smaller epsilon caused cuDNN launch failure.

body:
I got the same problem when I set the epsilon value less than 1e-5 on Ubuntu 16.04+CUDA 8.0.61+cuDNN 5.1.10. I used tensorflow 1.3.0 installed from source also.

According to the error, I read the cuDNN library user guide, and find the description about `epsilon` (in Section 4.95. cudnnBatchNormalizationForwardInference):
```
Input. Epsilon value used in the batch normalization formula. Minimum
allowed value is CUDNN_BN_MIN_EPSILON defined in cudnn.h.
```


So I check my cudnn.h, there is one line defined:
```
#define CUDNN_BN_MIN_EPSILON 1e-5 // Minimum epsilon allowed to be used in the Batch Normalization formula
```
I think that is why the smaller epsilon caused cuDNN launch failure.
